title: Speed vs. Tickets
question_text: Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved. Researchers surveyed a group of motorists, documenting their average speeds and recording the lifetime total number of speeding tickets each motorist had received. The data is recorded in the scatterplot above. The point $(59,10)$ can best be described as

choices.text: An influential point that greatly changes the slope, and a regression outlier.
An influential point that greatly changes the slope,  but not a regression outlier.
A regression outlier but not overly influential to the slope.
Neither influential to the slope nor a regression outlier.
